title: Carbondale police catch thief taking items with Ring Neighbors app | Crime and Courts | wsiltv.com
text:
CARBONDALE, Ill. -- Police in Carbondale caught a thief taking items from a home thanks to a notification from the Ring Neighbors app.
The Carbondale Police Department said it happened on December 28 in the area of Washington and Hester Streets. Police said they were alerted about a package theft by the Ring Neighbors app.
Police officers and detectives were able to get the photos from the incident and later found a suspect wearing the same clothing.
They also recovered the stolen items and were returned back to the victim.
“The Neighbors app has proven to be a very effective tool in bringing neighbors together by sharing information and creating a sense of community, as well as increasing the chances for a successful criminal investigation when the need arises,” Carbondale police stated in a news release. “Subscribers to the Neighbors app are not required to notify or communicate with police, and police do not have access to anyone’s cameras or knowledge of the address or owner information unless it is provided by the owner. Cooperation with law enforcement is strictly voluntary. For more information on the Neighbors app, click the link to the website that provides more details and FAQ’s, click here: https://ring.com/neighbors .”
